sentence.text: Tenascin-C (response to wounding), an extracellular matrix glycoprotein, has been implicated in progression of various types of cancer.
However, few reports exist on response to wounding expression in gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs).

The response to wounding mRNA and protein levels were found to significantly downregulated in tumors without progression compared to those tumors which occurred tumor progression during the follow-up period (P < .05).

As for the prognostic analysis, it revealed that tumor size, mitotic count, surgical margins, multivisceral resection, and response to wounding expression were independent predictors of PFS for gastric GISTs (P < .05).
